text: Disaster start to finish. Long wait for a table, really long wait for service, one order was wrong, one had guacamole that was grey/brown. Manager tried to defend it, which was just sad. In the end, to be fair, they comped our food, but if I'd eaten it, no comp could have made up for what would likely have happened. Eat at your peril.
Can't beat the midnight specials. My friends and I go at least once a week. The wild card special is straight fire. The waiters and waitresses pretty much know us by now and they're cool with us.

Hmmmmm    Where to start? 
We walked in and waited to be seated, we didn't wait very long. We were seated, this is where things got a littler irritating for us.  We sat and waited, waited and waited some more for about 10 mins. I remember seeing at least 4 different servers helping tables.  They weren't incredibly busy. However not one person acknowledged us or asked for drink orders.  Not even a polite smile.   We finally had enough,  got up and walked out.  Stopped and asked for a comment card and abruptly told the lady at the ice cream counter about our experience and she went to get the manager. The manager came over we told her....  She asked us if we wanted an order to go, we Sao not really we were hungry and really just wanted to sit down she offered us to take out booth back and said someone would be with us immediately.   They were and probably te ONLY smiling face we saw in there.   We got out drinks and ordered our food all at once (remember we already had 10 minutes to figure out what we wanted)   Food comes and it was hot, and good.  Thanks goodness.   We finished out meal and and asked for the check.   I don't expect a full comp or 1/2 off but a small discount would have been acceptable.   Oh well we weren't staying at this casino, we were shopping at the bass pro shop.

My husband and I both got the 16 oz. rib eye steak. My steak was cooked right but his was way under cooked. Service was good but regardless of tonights dinner ill probably come back in the near future.
Chef messed up but waitress and manager corrected, good customer service, food was decent

Loved this place for breakfast.  Nice menu. Cool atmosphere and even great lighting for a coffeeshop-type place. We shared two items, including a veggie egg scramble with spinach and chicken sausage that was excellent. Next time I'd go before 11 a.m. to score some deals. Not only that - but they serve very good coffee!
I arrived and was seated at a booth. After 15 min no waitress came so I left telling my greeter I'm moving on cause no one came to take my order.

Great food and the chicken fried steak is awesome. The food prices are not too bad but the fountain drinks, milk, lemonade etc are $3.00 each and $3.00 again for each refill! This adds up huge and quick because your drink is mostly ice plus they just keep bringing the drinks when you run out like an open bar tab!! Shame on you Silverton for gouging in your cafe but offer free drinks in your casino for gamblers.

Took forever to get seated.  Took another 10 minutes to get drinks and another 5 took see waitress who acknowledged us.  Short staffed. Great ambiance.  Needs better service.  Finally eating after 50 minutes.  Food is alright but nothing to wright home about.

Ordered the roast beef special for lunch.  The roast beef was spoiled.  This was my third and last time having a bad experience there.  Called over the waiter and told him.  He went to get manager and manager never showed up.  Zero stars here but forced to select at least one star on this app.  That cafe isnt even 1 star worthy.
Terrible service.   French dip was overcooked and plain - had to send it back.  I don't recommend to anyone.

Me and my wife are locals here in vegas and we like to support our local establishments but every time we come here its the same thing we wait for 20 min. To have our drink order taken and then another 15 min for our order to be taken while waiters just stand around like they have no idea what's going on. I work in the customer service industry and I would never treat my customers this way......TERRIBLE SERVICE ....Makes it hard to come back here , but we always do hoping things will change. Not this morning wishful thinking.

Expect not-so-fast service. (On the plus-side, you can have a meaningful conversation with your friends/family)

I think its a pretty great deal for the food!  This is one of very FEW places in Vegas that have healthy and FRESH + NON-FATTY food options that is not going to turn me into an obese ball like the rest of Las Vegas!  

I especially enjoy their grilled salmon with steamed vegetables and sometimes their salads with gravy on the side.  Their strawberry shortcake with ice cream is pretty good too!

I see some people expecting a 5-star service for their steak etc.  Come on.  this place charges over 50% less than a steakhouse!  How can you expect to get $50 service when you are only paying $15?!

I was impressed with our 2 servers. Everything went so fast and they kept an eye on us every 4 minutes. I don't know why we had two servers attending at us but it felt good knowing they're up to their par. Even though they were busy but they were able to manage each patron. This is the kind of service that I wanted most. Food was great also. I am loving the decor of this place. Very neat and decent. I am definitely going to come back to this place next time.

If it could be no stars it would be. After many years coming here. It went from great to rock bottom. Poor food even poorer service. Manager does not give a shit about whether or not your a happy customer or not. Bad!!!!

Good food, Awesome friendly service, always clean. We just love coming here!
You can get breakfast/lunch/dinner anytime.
They have great specials from 12am to 5am too!
Having the Chicken Parmesan tonight. Very good as far as coffee shops go. Service was pretty good. Very busy tonight.

This place is super good when it comes to a variety of things. The only reason why i didn't give it 5 stars is because they changed their menu around and got rid of a lot of tasty things, but don't let that ruin your opinion on how great their food is and how great their service is. And don't forget to gran some gelato you won't regret it!

Been coming to the Silverton for years and my favorite thing to do is eat at the cafe.  Food is always great.  Best steak and eggs I've ever had and has always been consistently fantastic. Midnight specials are very tasty. I don't care for biscuits and gravy generally but they're incredible here. Especially at 1am. I love this place.
Great service, food was hot and perfectly as ordered. Always made sure I didn't need anything. Great place to eat and not go broke.

Once again the Sundance Grill provided me and my wife with a breakfast that was outstanding.  Our waitress Lisa was a treasure.

We will be back next time we are in Vegas.

The only reason I gave it an extra star was because the food was was ok and decent portion sizes. 

Worst Customer service.  Asked what the soup of the day was...waiter had no idea and needed to go check.  Really? You don't know a basic question about your menu. The waiter had no personality and we could barely hear anything he said.  He never smiled once or checked on us throughout our meal. He took our order and brought our food then check...no "service" with our meal.  No drink refills or silverware for our child.  And the wait time to get our food was a little too long.  A sandwich, burger and quesadilla took 25mins to arrive.  And for the kids meal comes with a side of fruit...it was a slice of watermelon! Needless to say my kid wasn't happy with his fruit.

Terrible service. The Hostess - Holly is unfriendly and borderline rude. We waited half an hour to be seated (there buzzer did not work). When seated we waited 10 minutes and no one said anything to us so we left. We went to their other restaurant Mi Casa and sat at the bar and again waited 8 minutes with no service.

I took a party of 8 here for lunch, and to be honest wasn't expecting anything great, but I was very surprised. 
The food and drinks are a very reasonable price, and they have a nice selection to choose from. it all tasted good, and was served hot and fairly quickly.  the service was ok, not bad but not great.
Overhaul I did enjoy it and will go back here to eat.

If you have a large party, good luck. The service has been terrible the past few months. You wait over an hour to get seated and even the staff takes forever to get your food. They went from having stellar service to sub-par service. 
There are 3 waiters that are stellar and are worth your while. I don't know who does the staffing here, but it's terrible. 
Even the food quality has gone down. I don't know what's going on, but it's not worth the time.

A basic Casino coffee shop with a hit and miss menu. You are best off here getting breakfast or for a post midnight snack, when they will be a few specials. 

My standard order here is two eggs, hash browns, toast and some meat - either the ham steak or bacon depending on what I'm in the mood for. It seems strange to say this, but they have really good toast here and lots of options like sourdough, rye, wheat, etc.. It's sturdy bread and fresh, too. The hash browns have a tendency to come out undercooked, so ask for them to be cooked a little longer to ensure crispness. 

They have an okay burger here. Nothing to write home about, but good. Their fries are also good.

Service is friendly and thanks to a person who is charged with getting your drink order ASAP, it feels quick. If I'm in a hurry I'll sit at the very spacious counter, which has four or five TVs and enough elbow room to read a newspaper. I've not encountered a long line, but I am sure there are times when one exists. 

Aside from average food, my only other criticism would be the prices which do seem steep. The aforementioned breakfast with coffee will run you $8 unless you are eating in the wee hours of the morning and taking advantage of a special. 

My advice - don't go out of your way to come here, but if you are at the Silverton and need some food, it's a perfectly adequate option.

This has become a go-to place for us when we want a menu that spans all meals no matter what the time. The only issues are that the Silverton has some major construction going on that has messed up parking,  and the location of the place inside the casino is always tricky to find. But the food is decent and the service is good, so it's staying in the rotation.

Great service, the steak & eggs, and pastrami was very very good. Our waitress was very pleasant!  We were looking for a 24 hrs place to eat at 1:30am, but don't have to drive far. Will be back when I have to drop off my mom here for fun.  Very pleasantly pleased. Prices are very reasonable. The decor is nice as well.

My family and I CRUSHED IT  at the gym this morning, so much so, we deserved to have someone make lunch for us. We found ourselves at this place and I don't regret it.

I am a TURKEY CLUB junkie! Before trying anything else on any menu I HAVE to try the turkey club first. So that, my Yelp friends, is what I had. First know, the last time I had one of these sandwiches was when I dined at FARM. Now know this, Sundance Grill's TC was SO much better. Is it just me who thinks the bacon is always overly crispy for these sandwiches? This one, the bacon was cooked beautifully...friggin' delicious actually. 

Dessert...I'm usually, and by usually I mean ALWAYS, too full for it. But today I purposely packed half my meal to go so I could enjoy a sweet treat....I did earn it after all, went up in weights this morning at the gym woot woot! $3.00 for a strawberry tall cake with vanilla bean ice cream...YES! It was very satisfying and if I'm being honest (I always am) it tasted VERY similar to strawberry short cake, only a little more fancy because of the ice cream. My only regret was I shared it with my fiancé, he didn't even order a dessert I should have let him watch me enjoy it by myself. It was outstanding for 3 bucks. 

You know what, I always order turkey clubs but I never bother to look at the price. Is $9.50 an expensive club?...I kind of felt like it was.

Oh and, I had no idea you are suppose to take your check to the register at the exit. We sat there for about 10-15 minutes before we figured it out. Would have been nice if our server had mentioned it when he gave us the check haha.

As a SW Las Vegas local, I decided to try this restaurant because it's near my house . I would never go back again . The service was terrible . The hostess Kathy seemed like she had a big attitude for no reason . The staff was standing around in circles chatting not paying attention to their guests . You would think hospitality would be more important to them but It was all around not a good vibe at this restaurant at all . It seems like the staff doesn't even want to work there . When I left the restaurant Gemma didn't even make eye contact with me when she was cashing me out . Very disappointing

The Positive: Open 24 hours and served breakfast all day. Also had Keno to play while you ate. 

The Negative: The service was just ok. Waited 25 min for a table in a half empty restaurant.  Food took a long time and the ruben sandwich was dry and tasteless. Homemade chips where fresh, not greasy but had no flavor like everything else. I had to pour the salt on. I was also a little annoyed that the server made us pass out our own food instead of placing it in front of us.

Service here is horrible. They didn't page us for a table. I watched our server B.S. with another table while we were ignored for 15 minutes. I can't comment on the food because after a half hour, our sandwiches just arrived.

We had no problem with service and more than adequate breakfast food.On my last day I had to try the chicken fried steak smothered in gravy served with 2 eggs  home fries toast coffee wow it was great.We only had breakfast food there all was good.

This place rocks. Been here at least 7 times. I've gotten everything from chicken parmesan, to burgers, onion rings, late night eggs, hashbrown, bacon and sausage, buffalo wings, country french toast, corn beef and hash and the king-cut 18oz prime rib. 

The prime rib was great. The other items aside from the corn beef (ehhhh) were very solid dishes.

Service is great, drinks are always full and the servers are attentive and friendly. Prices are reasonable and I'll continue to keep coming back. 

The calamari is actually just okay. Very heavily breaded but overall this place has more than adequate food at solid casino prices and I'm a big fan.

Went to this grill twice last week. After a long day on the gun range my husband was too tired to go out of the casino to find something to eat. We got 4 different dishes in the 2 nights and were pleasantly surprised. I really like bolognese sauce on spaghetti and for a grill, it was excelent. Service was a little slow the second night but that's because it was packed...we choose seniors night to eat there! Would still recommend it to someone who needs a quick good meal.

Waiter great. Food great. I'd just stay away from the pie. We saw many plates and desserts pass us and the pie did NOT match up. The only thing that is say is portions are lovely except for the measly portions of pie. Waiter would have provided another piece whether we actually wanted it or not.. We only commented for it was so noticeable but the manager came by hearing only a part of our conversation if you could imagine halting any satisfactory resolution had we even been interested. Yes the manager! Crazy
The food is good. The problem is the service. We sat for a long time waiting on the server to come by.  This is the second time the service was terrible.  I doubt I'll come back.
This place has the worst service I have ever experienced in a very long time. Not sure if I'll eat here in the future.

We stopped in here because the Mexican restaurant we wanted to go to was closed. First off, we waited about 10 minutes to even be seated. Then our waitress seemed as if she really didn't want to be there. Great. We ordered our food (I got a burger) and it seemed to take a while to show up and additions I had requested were missing. I asked for a side of ranch for the fries, no ranch when the food came, asked again, still 5 minutes later no ranch. By time I got the ranch the fries were cold. Great. I was absolutely appalled by the taste of the food, the service and the entire experience. Never again.

You get a great deal for the money here, especially if you get one of their dinner combinations. The roast turkey is usually my go-to on this menu. Service is generally good, only had a problem once. Staffing has been improved. One thing I used to find very aggravating was to arrive and be told that there would be a 20-30 minute wait, when I could see vacant tables from where I was standing.

Update:
Since I wrote this review, Sundance dumped the turkey dinner from the menu, even though it was one of their more popular items. Prices have also gone up substantially since my last visit, and it isn't the value that it once was.

Delicious food & great service!! They pay attention to detail...my boyfriends 2nd drink came to our table looking odd and the server noticed it didn't quite look like the first one and took it back to get it made right!! Even the hostess that sat us was very pleasant and asked us about our day and whether we would like a booth or a table! They have something for everyone here!

My husband and I love eating breakfast here!
The ham and eggs are the best.
The waiters were friendly and very professional.
The service here was amazing.

Worse service ever. Left us standing in line. No one acknowledged us again. I have tried to eat in this restaurant before and left because of poor service. My girlfriend walked up to get an ice cream cone because we had waited so long and the girl at the counter turned and walked away four big thumbs down. No wonder the restaurant is half empty.

Decent service -- waiter was good; the rest of the staff could've been quicker/friendlier for a slow Friday night. 3/5 

Roasted Vegetable flatbread was amazing! Very low sodium. Great vegetarian choice; next time I'll try to request no cheese on the other veg flatbread (it'll probably be excellent as well). 4.5/5

Thee best deal here is their late night breakfast menu.  For most of us late workers at least.  I haven't been for anything else yet but the breakfast is great!  From midnight-5am they have breakfast plates up to $5.  You can also get $1 sliders!  

We go as often as we can.  If I lived closer I know I'd be there more often.  Beats Denny's, etc.
Service was slower than I expected but it wasn't bad.  Food was average but a tad pricey for what you get.

Excellent food, deep menu w/lots to choose from. Breakfast (my favorite) served anytime. I especially loved the French Toast, had that several times during my stay. Clean, modern, great/quick service. Highly recommended.

So I played a little and got a dining credit.  Good enough for three adults to enjoy a meal and dessert!

The wait was about 30 minutes but service was fast which made up for it.

Located deep in the Silverton Hotel and Casino, this gem is worth a visit.

The food is good and reasonably priced.

The staff are courteous and friendly.

What's great, is the more you play, the more you'll get free food, free play and rooms.

The ambiance is relaxing too.

Considering the restaurant is in the casino, its amazing that you can't smell the cigarette smoke.  Kudos to the hotel and casino for providing quality ventilation. 

I'll be back again when visiting family in Vegas.

Been here over 10 times, we stay at silverton a lot and this is a great little cafe. They have gotten quite pricey over the years. They have also changed their menu a lot as well. I personally prefer the Older one that offered the Alfredo pasta etc but what can you do. However the food and service never disappoints,

A food credit from the casino brought me into the cafe. I ordered a burger and a beer. The burger was good. The only reason for four stars and not five was slow service. I went on a Tuesday night, the cafe wasn't busy. It still a long time for the waitress to great us, receive my drink, and for my dinner to arrive. I will try this restaurant another time, I chuck up the slow service as a production problem this night and hope it's not the norm here.

Nice Casino, have come a long ways, but for this restaurant, forget it. The Hostess was so rude , was awful, totally ignored and rolled her eyes at me walking away---no customer service at all, i sure wish i had not spent so much money there in past to be treated this way.

the food awful--burger was frozen, no taste, chicken Alfredo was so bland, no sauce, the Ruben was so fatty, i would not recommend this at all---might tolerate a late night snack but don't go if you want to be treated by the worst hostess on this side of town ( Kathy) she needs some customer service classes.

I used to like eating here it's good food! This was NOT good at all. I came in at 6:30pm had four waiters standing up front and none of them greeted me they just continued in the conversation they had going on with each other, so i just sat myself. Then a waitress came up and told me no one is working this area but I'll help you with an attitude. She did come over and check up on me, but every time she did it was with an attitude. Never again 
Piss poor attitude!

I have eaten here several times and each time it was just ok. But this last time was terrible. The service was awful, my burger took 40 minutes, wasn't even cooked the way I asked, we sent food back for being cold...it wasn't good. Our server, Karen, was totally rude and just seemed like she didn't care one way or the other. I would rather just eat at Johnny Rockets than here again...

Silverton Cafe. Located by the pool so good spot to grab a bite to eat after a day of relaxing.

Its nothing special, typical cafe. Foods pretty normal and average. Service the same. 

Pizza, salads, pastas, etc.... Oh stop by the gelato spot on your way out its right in the front of the cafe.

Horrible Service. Extremely slow to seat us... and feed us... and water us... and bill us... slooooow.
We won't be going back.

I've been coming here for years & my recent visit will be my last. My uncle & I both ordered sandwiches & they didn't give us the pickle that it comes with. I know, very small to complain about, but if the meal says it comes with a pickle, it should come with a pickle. Also, they didn't give my mom ranch for her chicken wings. I used to like this place, but it seems like they stopped trying. For the last few times I dined in my food tastes as if it has been sitting under the heat lamp for quite some time. Service has plummeted & it really shows how much the staff hate their job. I do not recommend eating here, unless you don't mind being ignored or eating burnt, stale food.

I've been going here to eat for a few weeks now and never really gave a review. But, all it takes is one really bad time for me to think about giving a review. 

I sat next to another solo customer at the bar. We ordered at the same time with the same server. He got a burger and I got fish n chips. 

I waited. And waited. And the guy next to me got his burger. At this time, another guy sat to the other side of me and ordered something togo.

I'm still waiting. I'm thinking that they must've sent a fisherman out to catch the fish. 

So, the guy that ordered the to go after I had been waiting already a long time, he gets his order and mine comes AFTER his. 

But, I'm patient and figure it's going to be excellent. 

It wasn't. 

It was way over cooked, burnt outside and mushy inside. 

Total garbage. 

I don't think I'll come back again anytime soon. There is an enormous amount of choices to eat at. Why would I want to waste my time and money on something like that??

Horrible dinning experience from beginning to end. TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE if that what you call it. really needs a ZERO STAR RATING MAYBE NEGATIVE. They have a wait to be seated sign at the entrance. stood there waiting for around 10 mins, no one there. walked around but kept watching at a distance to see if anyone was going to return to the counter. NOPE. when the rest of my group arrived, we all store around again waiting. a guy in a suit finally came by, probably a manager with no explanations or apologies, and gave us one of those pagers and said we had to wait another 15-20 mins, NO VIP treatment for elderly and handicap here, walking canes wont even save you 10 mins of waiting. A man with a motorized cart, arrived after us the "manager" even gave him a hard time, but eventually he got in before us. this manager sucks a. i could be a suit too. 

when we finally got in total 1 hr wait, I was very pissed off to see that there was a lot of empty seating even a bar dining area that we could have ate at. they had coverage lots of it. as we ate dinner more seats started to fill . WTH so why the long wait!? 

the girl taking our orders had little knowledge about the menu, specials or any recommendation, clueless. we all ordered food that came with salads, the meal, and desserts. The Surf and Turf around $15 and pasta meals around $13. the rolls were cold and bowl of salad was good portion but regular. maybe a min later into our salads they brought out the food, good if we didn't have any salad, but really felt like they were rushing it, the concept of enjoying your dinning expedience is ENJOYING it. I wanted out now. 

Most of our steaks were burnt and tasted microwaved. The fried shrimp was the only good part about it. The pasta looked and tasted like it was left out for a while, one that you'd microwave from 99cent store. 

When it was time for dessert we waited and waited, Slice store bought apple pie and white sauce which I'm pretty sure was suppose to be ice cream. 


Refills on drinks slow, asked for steak sauce never got it, empty bowls and glasses still on the table piled up. the receipt came out fast, i guess they wanted me to pay for this. I AM NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN. Silverton has other places to eat.
Food was great. Open late!! Ate here 3 times while in Vegas! Good breakfast, great burgers and fried fish n chips, Hot coffee, and great service.

Excellent  choice. Lonnie was such an amazing server. Very attentive. Spot on with everything. Great recommendations. I went in wanting prime rib and it was more than amazing. Lonnie recommended several options and my husband went with his recommendation of fish and chips. Very well cooked. Perfect amount of food for him.

Stopped here for quick breakfast since our original plans failed so.It was me solo. First. Service was great. No empty coffee cup, food was quick, and very friendly and helpful staff. 
The menu had enough options on it to satisfy almost anyone. A few different type items, but mostly your standards. I got the bacon, mushroom, chive omelet, which was good. Hashbrowns weren't bad. I like them a little crisper through but I didn't ask for then to be extra crispy so that's my fault. Coffee is good. Toast, however was sad. I loathe toast that resembles bread warned enough to melt butter on. Soggy toast is a fail. 

The last time I.ate here it was much cheaper. This was a tad spendy for what it was. 14.xx for my coffee and omelette. Not terrible, but for the 24 hour casino restaurant, it was a bit much. I would probably eat here if I was here and the buffet wasn't open but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

I have been here twice... The first time was with family and loved it, the service was just ok. We asked for certain condiments and never recieved them. The second time I went in after a wedding around 1am for the 99 cent sliders. I sat at the high tops expecting fast service. I at for 27 minutes with out even getting a water. I stated that it was ridiculous and why I waited that long."we have a convention in town we are busy" I looked around and counted 9 full tables and 3 servers, there was no need for that oing of a wait. 

Displeased by the service but love the late night menu

We are Locals and went to Silverton Casino for a play and decided to have lunch out as we was meeting family there, I and my Husband had a meal with Fries, he had the philly steak and I had the Fish N Chips, the fish was fine but My Fries looked like they had been cooked in dirty oil and tasted that way also, My Husbands fries was looking under cooked and could have done with a few more minutes, the service was okay and the price was good but would be nice to receive fries with our meal that is cooked properly and hot as they was not!
Great little restaurant/cafe..everything I've had has been delicious. Wait staff is so friendly and attendive...5 stars all the way. Clean, good food, good people...

The food was ok but the service was bad. The waiter took our order then disappeared. The next time he came back was with the food. He gave us  our food and before we could blink he was gone. He never came back to ask if everything was ok or refill our drinks. He was back briefly to dop our bill on the table then he was gone.
Well damn... these crusted crunchy french toast are great. Paired with warm syrup and melted butter... bacon is only the second best thing on the plate!

I went to dine in before midnight on my actual birthday and after waiting 10 mins to get seated and another 10 mins we didn't get offered any drinks or water I decided I had no patience and got my food to go.  Brought the food and ate everything at another hotel.  The other person did not have the BLT but I did.  Next morning 10 hours later about noon I threw up all the bacon.  I knew for sure that bacon or sandwich was bad handled or the meat was bad.  Bacon is usually more red but the color was more brown.... I called Sundance Grill and asked for the manager.  Her name was Susan... she didn't seem interested in assisting me since she transferred me to security.  Don't ask me why but I let the Security Aaron in all the details and let him know that they need to look into the bacon, grease meat or ingredients in that sandwich.  He said he would contact the Food and Beverage manager.  I asked him to please follow up because if I don't have any explanation and I get even more sick and have to go to a doctor to treat this it forces me to report to the health department food poisoning control center and file a formal complaint.  Reason why I wanted to review so nobody else has to experience what I did.  It was like a bad hangover but from bad food.  So traumatizing I cannot go there to eat again.  I hope he follows up.

Came here a second time during a weekday around 9 PM. The food came out slow. The waiter was decent.

The food was just okay, again. The prime rib was cooked the way we wanted, but flavor was bland. The Reuben was very salty, although they happily piled on a thick chunk of meat. The best thing was the chicken fried steak. I may have to get that the next time around.

Overall, this place still gets three stars.
To me this place is cool. I like the food and the prices are good. Not to say that that u can get food anytime! Half sandwich and soup was a good size to fill up and tasted great. Good deal

We were looking for someplace to sit and enjoy a meal before we left Las Vegas. Last time we stopped at The Silverton we overheard some people talking about how much they liked the Sundance Grill, so we wanted to give it a try. We really liked it. Our server was friendly, came over quickly. This was Saturday night about 7pm. We had no wait for a table. The place was about 3/4 full. My husband got the prime rib and loved it. I got a spinach salad with shrimp on it, and it was delicious! This was a decent place, good service, good prices. We will be back.

I have been here several times.  Once, I had great service, another time service was just ok.  The last few times, service was horrible!!  The server forgot the fries with my burger and tried to say that I told him I didn't want any!  I think the food is decent and I usually take my kids here and we head over to the aquarium and Bass Pro Shops after we eat.

Located inside silverton casino.. One of the nicest cafe in all the local casino, the decor is kinda like country rustic and very clean.

The menu have change quite a bit, not for better!! I eat here cuz I have coupons .  They used to offer whole pizza for $10 but now it's small flat bread for the same price and not even good. The menu is cut smaller and the price gone up,  rather eat the other restaurants they have.

The few items that we always order is chicken fried steak $16, is a large portion and tasty.  
I got surf n turf $16 flat iron and fried shrimp, the steak is too chewy, thin and small .. Shrimp was very crispy and tasty just not the beef.  
Salmon grill with vegetables and mash potatoes is on the bland side.. Skip!!

This cafe have a gelato counter in the front where you wait to be seated. They have changed four different vendors and the last one is by far the best.. It's cheap and they give you a lot!!

First time to Sundance Grill. Regular grill food - had the spinach salad with grilled salmon with olive oil and vinegar for dressing. Had a few options for Gluten free, egg free and dairy free. 
Service was a bit slow but friendly.

I like that this is located in the Silverton, off the strip so there's parking spots close to the entrance available & not too many people everywhere.

I didn't like how heavily perfumed this place was! As I was sitting, waiting for my food all I could smell was the horrible air freshener or perfume they spray. It was giving me a headache & every time I tried to breathe in fresh air I would inhale more fragrance  it was enough to make me want to leave! But we were too hungry to do so. Luckily! Because the food was really, really good! 

I got the Traditional Club Triple Decker w/ no avocados. I didn't want any of the sides listed (coleslaw, fries, cottage cheese, or chips) so I asked if I could have fresh berries but the server said he could give me a fresh fruit cup for no extra charge instead! How nice!! I got the sandwich on 9-grain bread. I loved that they let us choose which bread we want! I will not order a sandwich on white or sourdough & I get so upset when I would love what's in between & cant change the bread so yay! & YUM! The turkey was good, the bacon was crisp & the bread was perfectly toasted. The fruit was fresh & sweet!! 

My boyfriend ordered a BYO burger. He had two meat patties, roasted red peppers, mushrooms, a fried egg, bacon, & cheddar cheese! It was served by itself on a plate with fries in a separate basket because it was so big!! It was super juicy, the egg was beautifully runny, the roasted red peppers were so so good, the beef was cooked perfectly!! We both loved it! The fries could have been cooked just a little bit longer though. 

They have a gelato bar when you walk out, I wanted some so bad but I was extremely full! It looked delicious but they had basic flavors. 

I'd give this place 5/5 if not for their overly perfumed whole Casino... 

But the food was good, server was nice, & prices were unbeatable!

I used to like Sundance when it just opened, but it has really gone downhill. 

The service is awful and the food is just as bad..

I've eaten here two times, and both times just like many Yelpers, I have discovered the service to be an issue.

The first time I came I sat at the counter and could SEE with my own eyes how bad things were.  The runners would get the food and come back 30 seconds later asking for fries on the plate, this happened multiple times and the staff just kept getting more and more angry.  At this point you would think someone would tell the cook "Hey these items require fries" but no, so I watched it continue.

There always seems to be a line to pay at the register as well and both times there would be a manager asking the cashier "Do you have things under control" instead of rolling up their sleeves and knocking the line out.

The food is OK, it's not bad, but I can get it so many other places and in some cases cheaper.  I don't see myself coming back unless I get a killer coupon or comp.

This place is really more of a three and a half star kinda place, but I was feeling generous and bumped it up to four stars. 
The place is easy to find, and very clean. They have a huge menu out front so you can see what they have to offer. They also have daily specials listed. Most dishes range between $8-$16. Also they serve breakfast all day long.
The kid meals are a pretty decent size, and my kids thought they tasted good (rigatoni pasta and chicken tenders). My husband had breakfast and said the biscuits and gravy were really good. They were also a good portion size. 
I had the grilled chicken Caesar salad, it was just okay. The chicken tastes like boiled chicken, not grilled. Also there were no grill marks on the chicken, not a big deal just weird. And almost half of the lettuce tasted old and wilted. On the plus side the dressing was really good. I ate it because I was hungry, but I don't think I'd order it again.
Good for what it is. A coffee shop and cafe. Clean ordinary food, when you need a quick bite without any pretense. Not overpriced. Fast friendly service.

I've been a loyal costumer for 3 years this upcoming August. The wait staff here is not that pleasant. They deal with people all day long that under tip or don't tip AT ALL!  They just assume if you have a dining comp with you you're not a fair tipper.  WELL!  I've always been fair with 18% OR BETTER and the people that have waited on our table know this.  I've seen so many faces in this cafe it's not even funny.  I like a place that has decent food and at one point I thought this place was OKAY!  I've checked in here numerous times. Met some unreal, prude like managers that swear there's nothing wrong with the food. But yet you tell me would you eat that undercooked? They'll just be upset & scowl at you.   Other times I've had pleasant experiences with staff & managers. Sadly the bad out weigh the good for us.  To the point where my boyfriend refuses to go here because he can't stand the wait or a particularly rude manager that used to work during the week (his days off).

I've complained about that particular manager in the past & sure enough she remembered us the next time. You'd think she would be pleasant and force a smile or get a different attitude than the apathetic look on her face.  If you hate where you work get a better education or don't get in the food industry.

My main reason for giving this poor rating is for the food quality which has plummeted over the past 2 years.  Somebody came up with a great allergen free dish called the Sweet & spicy Chicken wrap. It came with rice noodles on top, some wiz bang Sauce (guessing Asian fusion), chicken and it was probably something I would see off of Master Chef. You understand it looked beautiful on a plate.  OF COURSE it was not popular enough to stay on the menu because being America if it's healthy it's not for US! I was big contributor to this closed mindset UNTIL I found I can't enjoy certain foods anymore. Has they kept this dish on the menu I would probably still come around & put up with the miserable staff.  I miss coming in and being recognized by certain staff but I don't see them when I do have the nerve to stop in. It's a shame. I like being a regular and getting treated like a friend, you serve up the food I leave a nice tip we exchange "have a nice day/weekend". Call it a win. But I haven't had that experience here in a long time here.

 I wish Jon Taffer would fix this place so it's reasonably priced, with a hospitable & friendly staff that stick around.  I hate seeing a place with different staff every time I visit. It tells me a lot how the staff get treated.  But I don't blame them for leaving when some of the managers aren't the pleasant of people to talk with.

If they decide to send me a mailer saying they've revamped the place than sure I'd go back a few times to see how it is. I'm going to miss this casino because it's more my speed, I grew up in the sticks & loved the lodge theme but eh.  I won't stick around just for that.  Bring back the Sweet & spicy Chicken wraps if you DO revamp the place.  That was a winner in my book, simplicity is key when keeping low ticket times.

This place looks posh but is really just a partial step up from Denny's. They would not seat us with out silverware on the table because of some horseshit policy which is apperently monitored strictly by the manager. Our server Stephanie was pretty rude and when our eggs Benedict came back over cooked she tried to convine us to eat it anyway. Will not be back.

Dry tasteless salmon.  And...we waited 20 minutes for this  fish, without any drinks...because the waitress forgot what we ordered.
     Gosh and I  was so starved after the long drive, and this place appeared to look good.
   Nice waitress...but she forgot everything everyone ordered several times.  She forgot the drinks and silverwear.  I used the silverware from another table.

Got checked into my room late last night.  Was hungry, so I checked out the Sundance Grill...the 24-hr diner at the Silverton Hotel & Casino.  Got The Deuces Wild breakfast.  2 pancakes, 3 eggs, bacon, sausage & hash browns.   Holy smokes...YUMMM!!! .   My only complaint was the bacon.  I know most society prefers it "crispy", and the menu even lists their bacon as such, but I asked for it slightly under crispy.  I prefer it a little underdone.   My server said she totally agreed with me on bacon style and would request it my preference.  It came out crispy.  Oh well.  The eggs were perfect over-medium, hashed browns cooked perfect and OMG...the pancakes were amazing!!!

My server "Shayon" was awesome.   What a sweet girl!   Just topped off the visit.   

I highly recommend the Sundance Grill.  Might just make Silverton my hotel of choice when I'm in town.

Ok.. just arrived at The Silverton for our Rush weekend.  Came down to Sundance Grill for a bite to eat.  We have never had a bad experience here, but tonight we had waiter Brian.  He gave us GREAT service.  He is very friendly and accomodating.  He shouts out customer service!  Thank you very much!

So frustrated with this place! I always order an omelet here and every time it comes burnt. This is the third time and I specifically asked please do not burn it. It is so dry and gross when it's like that. The cashier who put in the order made a note and it's still burnt. Can you please teach your cooks how to make an omelet! It is not that hard =-(

Update:

I got their Reuben sandwich. It was really good. It's more than enough for one person. It's also inexpensive. I recommend it.

---------------------------------------------------

We ordered food to go. This place has a variety so if you're looking for pizza, it's here. If you're looking for sandwich, it's here. I do like their choices.

We got the chicken BBQ pizza. I thought it was really good. It came as a thin crust. It had the right amount of BBQ sauce. It wasn't drenched in it that it was all you can taste. I would recommend it. The pizza was like $13

Also got the fish and chips. It was good size for something that was $12. The breading was good. The oil they used to deep fry it tasted like it was old oil. Nevertheless, it had the right amount of crunch to it. I thought it was okay. The fries were fries. Nothing special to that.

I would recommend the place. The people were really nice. The ambience is pretty cool. I love the decor of the place. It's a really nice sit down place. You can sit at the bar and check out the behind the scenes. Just a cool venue. I would take a date here.

Clean fast service fresh food and great sever  Constantine always ready to serve us with a smile  clean silerwhear and cups and counters and chairs and emp. Well groomed and clean!!' Manager very nice and quick to day hello!' Love coming here we sit at the counter all the time cause u can watch tv also!' Steve and Paula love this place

I love the decor in the Silverton, and the same holds true with the Sundance Grill which is located inside. I have only had breakfast here, and it is pretty good. I don't know if I was lucky, or if Dita was unlucky, but I ordered the house potatoes with my breakfast, and they were hot and not overly hard. Not bad with a little ketchup & tabasco added. The service is so-so, which is pretty standard with 24-7 places. Overall, this place is A-OK.

We've been here numerous times and the food and service  have been pretty good (with food better than service).  But this time, oh my God!  After we sat at the table for a few minutes, the waitress arrived and said:  "Whaddaya Want?"  AND she said it with all the charm and personality of a prison matron.  And it went downhill from there.  Of all the waitresses we ever experienced, she's in the Top Three of the worst of all time.

We have discovered that going off peak to the Sundance Grill... and ordering the Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs is a great alternative to the Buffet.  The service has been great and the meal consistently good!  Go on Mondays and Seniors get 50% off your meal!

Horrid service and terrible food. Friday night at seven with an empty dining room should have been my first clue.
The waitresses and waiters have the personalities of a brick wall. I've had better revive at a gas station. 
My wife had the New York steak and veggies. Her steak was about a half inch thick but she said it was ok. I ordered fish and chips. Both our meals came with a salad and a role. I love salad dressing or anything that hides the taste of anything that looks like a vegetable but my salad was swimming in dressing. There were floating croutons and a life raft that looked like a cucumber. The roll was good.
My fish and chips were among the worst I have ever had. I have had better fish and chips in an elementary school. The fries tasted like they had been sitting around for a few hours and the pieces of fish were dripping with grease. The coleslaw was brown and looked bed. I wasn't even willing to try the coleslaw. The fish was over cooked so the meat was tough and dry and the batter was a dark brown that tasted like the grease was weeks old.
When I told the waiter that my meal was so bad, he chewed me out and told me I should have told him sooner. He did offer me something else but I declined. He said he has replaced meals "many times." This should be a problem in his eyes. He did take the meal off our bill but did charge us for the salad. Amazing that they would nickel and dime a patron who had a bad experience. My whole meal should have been removed from the bill. When this restaurant first opened, many years ago, there were long wait times but the food and service was great. THIS IS NO LONGER THE CASE.
save yourself some time, money, and a stomach ache, avoid the Sundance Grill at the Silverton.

Clean with contemporary and open feel, friendly service, typical american coffee shop with burgers, sandwiches, plates around $10-20 per person. i tried the chicken noodle soup, turkey club sandwich, and burger, which were all decent and tasty but not memorable. the fries are thin shoestrings, which are tasty and a generous portion is provided, and they do accept silverton points as payment, which is how we ended up here. 2.5 stars

My husband and I had breakfast here this morning. Not sure if they were having an off day but my meal was not good. The water had a weird taste, hash browns were soaked in grease but not crispy. It seemed they cooked them at a very low temp. Eggs were good, sausage was not. My husband had a fruit, yogurt and granola bowl that was delicious. Service was very good.

I've probably been here 20 times and there's a bit of a learning curve when it comes to the food and service that you get.

Most recently I came with my fiancee around 5:30 AM, unfortunately too late for the cheap late night menu, but the food is still a good price regardless.  Even with nobody else waiting to be seated it took a minute or two before someone noticed that they should seat us.  There were at least 2 servers around and only 3 other tables when we were seated and it took quite a bit of time to get drinks, have them take our order, etc.

My fiancee got eggs (awful) and sausage (great) while I got a burger and fries.  I asked for and double checked that my burger would be plain, but when I got it, it was clear that the cook had put on everything and then scraped it off so he wouldn't have to make it over again.  By "clear" I mean there was still some lettuce on the plate and burger.  I asked to have it remade and the server told them and strangely enough I got it back 1 minute later -- yes, they had literally just scraped the remaining lettuce off and served me the same burger.  I again asked to have it actually remade and finally they did.  Amongst all this I ended up getting old lukewarm unsalted fries (99% of the time their fries are to die for, but I guess they decided to fuck with me because they messed up and I wouldn't let them take a short cut out of making the order properly).  Additionally when they were preparing the order the first time they started the eggs and burger at the same time, so my fiancee's plate was sitting in the window for 10 minutes getting cold while mine was finished.  

It ended up that I got my correct burger 5+ minutes after my fiancee was finished eating.

Normally I would just give a place 1 star for service this bad, but because of actually having good experiences here before I'll give it 2.  If you want some tips: try to eat at the counter as the service there is usually pretty good.  Pastas, burgers, breakfast, and sandwiches are all pretty good.  I'd suggest staying away from the pizza.

I am gluten free due to allergy. The restaurant advertises a gluten free menu thru staff if asked at the hotel. They have one grill and a limited GF menu. However that is ok..I'm happy there was anything at all. There are no warning for gluten contamination possibility on the menu. I ordered breakfast at lunch. The food was excellent but I was heavily cross contaminated. I should have know better. My son had chicken fingers which he said were awesome. I'm giving them. 3 star because they need to be aware of the impact of allergies and remove the gluten free menu.

I had breakfast here alone after checking out Sunday morning.  There was a long line and there was no hostess.  After several minutes she finally showed up and told everyone that the wait would be around 10-15 minutes even though there were a ton of open tables.  

Since I was alone she wanted me to sit at the counter but I HATE eating at counters so I told her I would wait for a table instead.  She seemed disappointed.  Oh well...and the waitress didn't look to happy to serve a table of one either.  I ordered an omelet and a coffee.  The omelet was good but it was served with a small portion of hash browns...not like I remembered from before.

I gave the waitress a big tip since I was dining alone and I know that she could have gotten a bigger bill from a party of two or more.  I would come here again though and the prices are decent.

Looking for a place to eat in that area of town, went into Silverton Casino and came across the Sundance Grill.  One of my friends ordered the shrimp hoagie, another a turkey club sandwich, and I ordered the Tuesday special, Sloppy Joe with fries and drink included, $9 bucks.  We all  commented on how great the food was and our waitress Lisa was attentive, I think this is a place to return to.
The food here is okay, the flavor always varies depending on the day and time I come here (and I come here quite often because silverton gives me some free dining credits)

Blah food. Dated bland decor and poor service on numerous occasions. We only tend to come on Senior Mondays as the 50% discounts bring the price in line with the food value. My husband is the reason it gets two instead of one star. He is easy to please as long as there is eventually table service.

A-OK coffee shop. Since we wanted to take advantage of the BOGO deal going on we went here for breakfast. We got the basics bacon and eggs with coffee. Everything was good except the house potatoes or whatever they were called, more like dry, hard, cold chips. The sour dough was great and our food was served quickly. The service can be hit or miss here. We've come on other occasions and enjoyed other meals too. The ham steak and eggs is ginormous. Prices are also reasonable and with the free offer we paid $10.70 for breakfast!

Food is here actually pretty good.  I've come here quite a few times for the mere fact it always seems to be the only restaurant open in the Silverton Casino.  I've enjoyed the hamburgers, shrimp cocktails, and breakfast.  Service is so/so and I don't like the fact you have to pay for your bill at the cashier.  However, food is great and they can usually accommodate large parties and there are plenty of booths for good conversation; not too noisy.

The food was okay when we went in December 2016 during NFR. I ordered the Philly cheesesteak(which was pretty good, although the meat was awful dry) figuring it was a safe bet compared to choosing seafood in the middle of the desert. WRONG. Not long after, I spent the worst 5 hours of my life with some nasty food poisoning that I could only link to what I had for dinner here, as I had not eaten really anything for several hours prior. Personally, I most likely will not eat here again thanks to that experience, but I do have to say that the staff was very amicable and prompt. But do check your meat before you eat!

This is your average casino cafe that is open 24 hours.  

They do have a large menu that includes breakfast items, steaks, sandwiches, salads, asian, and desserts.  The menu could use more vegetarian and healthy options though.  The portions are also large, so it is a pretty good value.

The quality of the food itself, is about average to occasionally below average.  Fish and chips left in the fryer too long, stale fries, etc.  The biggest drag on its ratings however is the service.  The servers are friendly and they are working hard, but they always, no matter what time of day, seemed understaffed.  Everyone seems to be running around like headless chickens.  So drinks remain unfilled for a while and sometimes your order takes forever to be brought out.

The Sundance Grill is just your average all night casino cafe, serving up diner type food, unfortunately it really lacks the service.

I eat here every time I'm in Las Vegas. The food is always good one time we had an issue, my chicken was undercooked and they took care of it immediately. The service is the real problem. It's very hit or miss. We've had the best service here and we've had the worst service here. This past week was the worst service we've ever had at Sundance. Our server clearly didn't know what was going on. He was confused by everything but he was trying so I'll give him credit for that. We were here for breakfast before we checked out so I went with my usual breakfast burrito. A solid choice. My dad had an omelette, I forget what they called it but basically a western omelette. His came with a choice of meat, bacon, sausage or ham. When he ordered the sausage the waiter was beyond confused. It clearly states that you have a choice of meat but my dad had to point it out on the menu. My burrito comes and it's good but they left off the sour cream and salsa that's usually on the plate. My dad starts eating his breakfast and anger a minute he realizes they forgot his sausage. When our server comes by he didn't know what we were saying. It was really annoying. So I eat and head for the casino while my dad waits for his sausage to show up. I'm done playing and he's paying at the counter. I walk up and he's talking to a cashier because we were charged for the sausage. She had a bit of attitude. We saw it when we came in and she told a couple in front of us to wait at the front while she set the table. None of us could figure out why they needed to wait but whatever. She asked my dad "which one did you have?" I don't know how that mattered which one he actually ate if it's wrong it's wrong. She had to get a manager to remove the charge. We like eating here, when we stay on the strip we come here for a meal. The food is real good I'd give that 5 stars but the service is so varied you never know what you will get.

4 Stars for their Food
2 Stars for their Service

I have eaten here about 3 times and every time I have had the worst service. 

Here's today's experience.  We initially get seated and asked what we want to drink.  Drink arrives fairly quick and I ask the question "What's the Soup of the Day".  Waitress responds that she doesn't know and will ask someone else.  Another waitress arrives and ask us what we wanted to order.  We asked for a minute, which means, come back in about 5 minutes.  This doesn't mean ignore us for the next 15 minutes while you chit chat with another guest.  The waitress must have noticed that we were beginning to wait impatiently.  She arrived at our table and asked us if we were ready.  I responded yes and she immediately said she'd be back. ???????

Finally came back and took our order.  I had the Country Fried Steak, Eggs, Hash Browns, and Biscuit/Gravy.  Eggs were a bit runny, but the rest of the food was perfect.  Portions and price are good.  Big portions and fairly cheap.  Besides their eggs, the food is always fresh.  

It always seems to take some time for them to take your order here.  Happened to me all three times I've been here.  But the food almost makes up for it.

Sorry to say but this place is really starting to slip. Both in service and food quality. I've eaten here approximately 3-6 times a month and the last 3 or 4 times have been a disappointment. The prime rib which was always one of my favorite, was both smaller than usual and had more fat than usual. Most of the food is still descent at best but the service leaves much to be desired. Being busy is understandable but to ignore a customer for a simple glass of water while they wait to have their order taken is unacceptable. That seems to be a regular occurrence now. Very sad considering this was once a great spot to have a nice meal at an affordable price while feeling you bring some value to the place. Not sure if it's new management or understaffing but something has definitely change and it's not for the better.

Came here the first night I was in town for dinner. They weren't busy so we decided to come instead having to wait for a busier restaurant. Huge mistake! We were sat almost immediately, got our menus and everything seemed like it would be okay. It took 20 mins for our waitress to even come over and take our order. Mind you there was only about 4 other tables being occupied. Food wasn't great just your average food. Step up the service and this place might be okay.

I love this place!

They recently updated their menu format and changed a few things. 

We had: the grilled salmon and spinach salad, a quesadilla (no chicken), garlic shrimp pasta, chicken penne pasta, and a tomato and basil pizza. Everything was DELICIOUS! 

Salmon salad is soo good! Fresh, flavorful and somewhat healthy. The salmon fillet was large. 

Quesadilla is a great starter, came with pico de gallo, salsa and sour cream. Everything was fresh. 

Garlic shrimp pasta was tasty (but oily). Shrimp could've been fresher but was still good. 

My boyfriend liked his chicken penne pasta, but he thought my garlic shrimp pasta was better.

Pizza was AMAZING as always. They have a fire brick pizza oven thing which they cook their pizzas in. 

Our server was very sweet and friendly. 

Overall I'm very impressed with their food and quality, as it is a casino coffee shop. I will be coming back!

The ice cream from the gelato stand out front is great as well. 2 scoops for $3!

I have been to this Grill several occasions over the years. Service is usually slow, but the food has always been decent, such as the Fish and Chips.
We are back in Las Vegas for the winter, thought we get some fish and chips and do some gambling.

Well that didn't happen. Showed up today around 1:30 p.m. Had three couples in front of us, the hostess seated the first couple. Then we stood their waiting, and waiting. Meanwhile the cashier is having a heated discussion with another employee, manager walks up, frowning the whole time, and asks the cashier a question, looks up at the line of people waiting and walked off.

 The hostess returns and takes the second couple. Then we wait and wait, then the manager walks up to the cashier and the other employee who are still in a deep discussion, asks her something again and still frowning, looks at the line again and walks away.

Meanwhile the cashier gets some customers to ring up, the employee keeps griping to the cashier the whole time she is helping the guests. Meanwhile we are still waiting for the missing hostess to return. Then the manager walks up, asks the people in front of us how many, he says 2 and he hands them a beeper and says it will be 15 minutes.

 Then looks at us and we say 2, he then says 15 minutes. My husband said to him we have already been waiting 15 minutes, the reply from the manager, looks like you will be waiting another 15 minutes.

What, no apology, no nothing, just a sour look on his face like he just ate a lemon. I told him we really enjoyed the show with the two employee's and we walked off.

We left the casino without playing any machines, and went to In and Out Burger across the street. Then went to South Point to play.
I always get the turkey burger GREAT by the way but lately craving big American breakfast plus stack of pancakes EXCELLENT

One star is saying alot.  I am a frequent customer here because of comps from my gaming, but quite frankly I cannot bring myself to go back.  A few weeks ago on a Saturday night I was alone and sitting at the counter.  It was 10PM and I ordered the shrimp with linguine.  After waiting 45 minutes I said something to my server.  She said they were busy but my shrimp were on the fire.  15 minutes later I still have no food.  Then some friends came in and I moved to their table, and after they ordered their food my food finally arrived.  There was no linguine only over cooked spaghetti, a few overcooked shrimp and no garlic bread.  Well this past Saturday night were were in there again and I ordered the Jumbo Shrimp cocktail to start.  After ordering our waiter came over to say they were out of shrimp and it would be a few minutes before they cooked more.  Then the waiter comes to our table with a plate of the worst looking shrimp which were below par of their buffet ones and I promptly told him to bring them back, there was no way I would pay $11 for that.  About 10 minutes later waiter comes back to the table with their version of Jumbo Shrimp, warm and not very good.  I was insulted they would even serve that to me, a high level player at that casino.  I had informed the manager when I paid the bill that they never should have served the shrimp and he politely said he knew.  If he knew why was it served to me?  Bottom line here is that a comp isn't even worth it!!!  Service was OK, but the rest of the meal, including my rib eye which was ordered medium and came out barely cooked, was awful.  I did not send the steak back because at that point in our meal I thought I will just take it home and eat it tomorrow.

I used to like this cafe, but my last visit wasn't good, very disappointed with their food. 
My calamari was so greasy and bread for my sandwich was dried out and looked old.

Compared to the customer service at the buffet, this place is pretty crappy! They literally ignore you when you walk up to be seated and just walk around you like you're not alive. That is so rude! The food is pretty bland. I have tried the chicken Parmesan probably the best pasta. The chicken Alfredo was had no salt, no flavor and maybe 5 pieces of dry chicken breast. W have been sitting at the bar seating and have been waiting 40 min for an omelet and my mom ordered eggs.... not only that but they always say 15-20 for regular seating when they are not even FULL. A plethora of empty seats. When we were paying at the cashier it took an extra 10 minutes because they gave a hotel player club member the wrong price for the bill he was so upset he said they continue to give him the wrong price and that he was going to pay exactly what was in the bill. The manager immediately said she was going to call security. That was horrible in my
Opinion a manager is supposed to diffuse and resolve an upset customer. Not jump to calling security and just walk off..... odd.

I'll follow the others and say, "typical casino cafe." There was nothing special about it other than the fact that they were open late and served pizza (or flatbread).  We ordered two and both were decent.  Our daughter ordered a banana split and it was huge! She loved it! The service was quick and friendly.  The wine was cheap and "cheap".  Stop in if you're staying at the Silverton and looking for a quick bite to eat.

This is NOT a place to be at!  Asking for a rare prime rib and I t comes out well done. 5 orders of prime rib just terrible. Do not come here!!!!  Manager says the chef can not cook a rare steak. WTF!!!!!

Lets just say i had a really horrible time at this place and I'm never coming back. 

I went here with family, first time meeting my mom-in-law's boyfriend. The server was probably going through a really sh*tty day, so she was COMPLETELY rude. We probably asked 3x where our steak was since it's been 30 minutes, and she said some really rude things (i forgot what it was now since this was a few months ago) which made me go to the bar and ask for their manager. I think she saw I was gonna go talk to her manager so she apologized and 5 minutes after that, our food finally arrived. I want to say it was worth the wait, but it wasn't. The steak was dry, gravy was too watery, and the food overall wasn't all that great.

Went for a late breakfast. Service is excellent!. Biscuits and gravy are so scrumptious. I added a side of sausage links which was a great idea. Kids got a small kids breakfast, bear shaped pancake sausage or bacon and eggs. They loved it. I got the cornbeef hash which is my all time fave, but theirs was ok. Also the breakfast specialties do not come with toast or even hash browns so be careful of what you order.

Food is great,  service isn't.  Breakfast or late night is where this place shines.  Breakfast or late night,  the service is lackadaisical and without energy. Might as well be dealing with robots or a walking pad of paper. 

Beware the ham! Holy cow it's HUGE! The first time here I thought it was a fluke. Second time, thought it was *maybe* just that the cook liked us. Third time, it seems a standard. A quarterpound slice if not larger.

Omelettes are large, coffee is good. Ambience is casino restaurant.

Great food!  Great service!  From the waiter to the bus boy, this place is top notch.  This is a great place for any meal of the day.  Lots of items to choose from and everyone I have tried was delicious! Very nice atmosphere.

Most of you know I'm a chicken fried steak junkie.  My friend told me this one was good, so I visited to see for myself.  I asked the waiter if it's freshly battered and he said it's not.  I got scared it was going to be like spam meat like Mimi's Cafe.  When the steak arrived, I looked good and it didn't look like it was a frozen steak and it wasn't like spam.  It was a large flank steak tenderized, breaded and deep fried crispy.  I think the waiter meant it wasn't battered right before it goes into the fryer.  I think this steak is prepared in advance on the premise and put into a container for quick cooking later in the day.  I don't think it's a frozen steak pre-battered shipped in a cardboard box.  The steak was so big, they have to cut it in half to put it on the plate.

Dined here a couple of times on my stay at Silverton Nov 11/12, 2011 and the service and food are back up to the levels of my first few visits.  Fair prices, good food and service over all is good...always great service if you sit at the counter though when Betty Jean is on shift!  Awesome lady.

I got here late in the afternoon to take advantage of my $15 dining credit. For what I got, this place was pretty good.

I came after a full day of class with an empty stomach. I originally planned to use my credit towards the buffet, but the line was too long so I went here.

I was seated promptly by the hostess. A waitress then came and got my drink order. As for food, I ordered the country fried steak with eggs and toast (I love breakfast food for dinner) and a to-go order hamburger with fries.

The chicken fried steak was good. It wasn't oily or dry. The gravy tasted amazing. The eggs were perfectly cooked just the way I like them: sunny side up. I didn't try the burger because I took it home for my family, but they enjoyed it.

The waitress was very nice. She was attentive. However, she didn't bother to ask to refill my water. It was just me, so maybe she was busy attending to other patrons.

In the end, I only paid $2.70 plus a few bucks for a tip. Not bad for an eat-in meal and another to-go.
The potato and bacon soup on monday's and the corn chowder any day is the BEST!!!

Had a few different experiences at this restaurant, but overall the food was good...pretty much what lacks here is the service. The last time I was here the cook had to double check the order to make sure it was made correctly (thank goodness) and the manager brought out the food... can I tip them instead? 

The first time I came here I had their surf/turf 3 meal special and they forgot to bring out the wine. the wine! gotta have that! 

but it's open 24/7, food is good and decent price... so.... I'll return :)
i guess its okay.. ceazer salad is one of my fav things from here

Sundance Grill is inside the Silverton casino. Right by the back entrance so it's convenient to get to. This is cafe food so don't expect the greatest food when you go. We come here often because it's close to our house. Typically never busy and the pricing is pretty good for what you get. For breakfast I usually get the Greek omelette. Omelette is pretty big, comes with hash browns and toast all for $10. Other breakfast places that would be around $13-$15. 

Service is kinda slow, not sure why maybe not enough servers for the size of the cafe.
typical casino cafe, I really do not have anything bad to say about it. nice decor, friendly staff... I ordered  the omelet with bacon and spinach and It was a pretty good  choice

Came for breakfast. I ordered the eggs Benedict when it came my eggs were over cooked and the hollandaise sauce tasted like mayonnaise. I tasted the sauce several times to make sure I wasn't crazy it even had the consistency of thick mayonnaise. I asked for something else and just ordered a short stack of pancakes. It took awhile for my stack to come but when it did they were raw in the middle. I do have to say the service wasn't bad even thought the food was.
Highly recommend the Joe's Shuffle, Moco Loco & Huevos Rancheros.  The gelato bar selection and quality is just 3 stars but hits the spot if you have a craving and don't want to leave the casino.

Food was good. The Cook really knows his way around the eggs! They also have some great late night specials after midnight. Try ' em! Servers could use more cigarettes break because they are mostly mean, spiteful and crabby but,  the  food makes up for what these ugly gals lack in customer service skills. Two thumbs, wayyy up!

I've been here a few times with the family because my parents always have discounts, coupons, or comps. I don't like this place very much, but I always hold out hope that I'll find something decent on the menu.

Some items I've tried:
Buffalo Wings with Chipotle BBQ ($10)
Traditional Club Triple Decker ($10)
Flatbreads ($8-9) with extra toppings ($0.50-1/each).
Fish & Chips ($12)
Chicken Fried Steak ($16)
Fresh Grilled Salmon ($17)
Chicken & Artichokes Pasta ($14)
House Salad

The food is just okay. Sometimes less than okay. The items that were decent eats: Buffalo Wings, Club Sandwich, and Chicken Fried Steak. 

Service is fine. It's usually not very busy.

The Service was great!  We got the daily special for $9.  That included our choice of soup.  The New York strip sandwich was very tasty and huge!   The fries were salty and tasty. The chicken noodle soup was cooked to perfection. 
We will be back!

Since we are constantly looking for good breakfast place, we just found Sundance recently!
After a rocky start, learning their menu ... and of course servers had to learn about us too, finally we are comfortable eating at Sundance.
Items ordered:
Steak and eggs ; Sweet potato hash and eggs; Classic eggs Benedict; Grilled Vegetables Panini; Philly cheese steak sandwich; Prime Rib French Dip; Prime Rib dinner.
Everything we ate was good, tasty, well presented.
All of our food were freshly prepared in a timely manner.
Prices are moderate, averaging $10-$12 for sandwiches with sides, $10-$15 for lunch items, $10-$18 for dinner entrees with soup or salad.
Non alcoholic beverages are $3 each.
Everything is available to order 24/7 .
They've a late night specials from Midnight through 5am, Ham steak and eggs $3.99; Sliders .99 cents each ... 
Sundance is a nicely decorated, clean, well maintained restaurant.

We noticed the servers are very friendly to the customers! We also had nice conversation with the restaurant manager. Their priorities are serving good food and provide excellent customer service!
We'll be happy to return to try other items from their menu!

Avoid at all costs.Worst food I have eaten in years.

 Ordered corn beef hash. Was greasy, flavorless and undercooked.  They served it with a sauce that I can only describe and something like licking a grease trap. I nearly threw up.

I was with two other people who ordered the "Big stack" and a salad..similar experiences.

On top of all that, the wait staff was rude and lazy and refused to take the meals off our bill.

I will never eat here again.

Let me just say that I come here because constantin has been the greatest guy here. Since I can remember. He was the manager but prefers just giving great service.  

He is truly an asset to this little spot in this old casino. 

He deserves everything you can give him Silverton.

Come here only for breakfast and order one thing only. Order the barbecue brisket skillet with hash browns and eggs on top...topped with onion straws.

This dish is a game changer and so damn tasty. Go check it our for yourself. So next time you stop at Bass Pro shop mozy on into the casino and check out their casual restaurant and order this!

By the way only three stars because everything else is just ok.

Very nice casino, and fun to take a break from the action & walk through the Bass Pro Outlet store for a while.

  But this review is for the Sundance Grill.   I wish I could give it 2.5 stars -- my experience was a little better than "Meh, I've experienced better" (though that *is* certainly true) but to me, the place doesn't merit an A-OK" rating.

 It's a clean, nice looking place (but it shouldn't get points just for that), there are some TVs up above the counter seating area.  The person that sat me had to break-away from the ice cream operation at the front counter to seat me, and she walked with her hand in her pocket like she was ready to pull a knife on me.    The waiter was friendly, service was fairly fast -- I got my food about 13 minutes after ordering.

 I had a hamburger that came with fries.  I had to pay to add a slice of cheese, and I also ordered a side of cole slaw.    Just water to drink.

My bill was a little over $15!   Sorry Sundance, but you're not a trendy, touristy place nor are you on the expensive Las Vegas Strip.    You're open 24/7, which is cool, but I shouldn't pay a premium prize to subsidize your 24/7 operation.

The food wasn't worth it, unless you're staying at the hotel & you need a late or early meal.   I have a 50% Off coupon I could use on another visit (I'm a local) but unless I need to go to Bass Pro Outlet for something & am hungry while there, I'll likely throw the coupon out & just try somewhere new, or a place where I know I get better value for my $$.

Okay so.. I get here @ 6:00 am and the hostess is standing at the cash register talking to a waitress. I wait the waitress walks off with out telling the hostess.... So i give her a few minutes... I get fed up and ask her do i just sit my self down. Her answer "oh i am sorry honey i didn't see you". She immediately sits me down. So my waitress is really nice and awesome. So I ordered steak and eggs which was awesome. The corned beef and hash not so much., food service was fast . But my waitress disappeared. Had to get a different server whose name was angel. Who served us with a smile but then couldn't find him again had yo get the hostess who was seating a party to get the bill. The food and the waiters an waitress are the only redeeming qualities here.

My wife ordered a steak salad and I had the sirloin, both ordered medium rare.  And of course, both were medium well.  We don't usually send food back, but we're going to do so from now on, and we did.  Our new meals were similar to the first ones, but the wife ate hers anyway.  Mine was cooked MORE than the first one, so I just ate the potatoes and veggies.  When the waitress came to take our plates, I said "the cook REALLY doesn't know how to cook a steak, does he?"  She didn't apologize, didn't take the charge off our bill, or anything.  All she did was shake her head and hand me the check.
Never again...

Tonight we ate here for the second time. I ordered the club sandwich and my husband had the double cheese burger with bacon on brioche bun. They were both served with shoestring fries. We normally both don't care for shoestring fries but we both loved these. They were super fresh, hot and flavorful. I loved my club sandwich. It had avocado on it and they were very generous with the bacon. Delicious! Also the decor is pleasant and it has a warm comfy feel. As far as cafés in the area, this is the best by far. Runs circles around South Point's cafe which has mediocre food and slow service.

We went late, maybe 10:00 pm. The place was nearly deserted. Service was nice, food was good and came out quickly. I ordered a breakfast burrito and it was amazing and a good portion for the price. I'll definitely go back just for that! I'm only giving four stars though because the floors were in need of a vacuum or at least a sweep. There were staff standing around doing nothing with trash on the floor by some of the booths.

**Summary**
       - Meat - I've tried 3 of their meats and the rib eye was the only thing that I'd order again. It's also a really great value for what you're getting.
       - Meal vs. Entree - With the exception of the Surf n' Turf, the other entrees let you get a drink, dessert, and soup or salad for $5 bucks more.
**Ordered**
       - $14.99 Surf n' Turf - Ordered medium rare. Steak was soft but super dry.
