The deal does come with a drink, dessert (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/H8umkLwMkM0vP5B8oPiozQ?select=EcrK2N5SP4f_EQkRh2I-Pg), and a soup or salad, so it wasn't a bad deal (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/H8umkLwMkM0vP5B8oPiozQ?select=ZTtJfOIzkl3Yx2lgYxGCOw).
       - $15.95 Rancher's 16oz. Rib Eye - This has been the only meat I've ordered from this place that hasn't been dry. The seasoning is really good and the meat is tender. A great value for $16 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/H8umkLwMkM0vP5B8oPiozQ?select=XVnwdtHVFBux7aWlTbgesw).
       - $15.95 15oz. King Cut Roast Prime Rib of Beef - Ordered medium rare. The prime rib was nice and thick but super dry and a huge let down.
**Recommendations**
       - I'd recommend this place for their rib eye. It's delicious, big, and juicy. The other steaks/prime ribs I've tried have been trash.

It's horrible. Worst service ever. Couldn't get the order right. Return the food due to it being so cold just paid out for the meal but wouldn't give the tax money back. I will never suggest anyone to eat here. They forget everything. I had to reorder my food twice. Fuck it here.

If you order the cornbeef hash and eggs, you wont get Hashbrowns, servers will tell you the hashbrowns are in the cornbeef hash. True story!  The food servers are weak and they are very slow.  The food is good, it taste fresh and the orders come out rather quickly, just the servers are slow.   I am really not sure if management cares that the servers are slow and at time they take forever to get water or drinks and that coffee cups are always empty.    We like Silverton, just hate the sevice in the Sundance Grill.  I will tell you the breakfast servers are faster then the dinner servers, that not say much, because the Dinner staff is really weak.

I had the fried chicken, which wasn't impressive.  A little bit of seasoning or something would be nice.  I had the meal, which included dessert.  While I was working through the chicken, the waitress brings my dessert!  Which had ice cream in it!  I was nowhere near finished with my chicken, what in the world would compel you to bring my dessert so that it could melt while I'm eating?!

I mean, come on... it's not rocket science!

Great prime rib. I got the small and it was so delicious. They cooked it great It had veggies, potato, and soup or salad. The wait staff was great We had Miklos and he was warm and friendly Three dinners for $70 what a deal

We had stopped here to check out the aquarium and decided to have some dinner here too.  We were on a budget and trying to eat at decent places.  Most of the restaurants in this casino were rather expensive but Sundance Grill was reasonably priced.  
I ordered the Rigatoni Bolognese which looked to be a small portion for the price but it was rather filling.  I couldn't even finish it.  It came with Garlic Bread which was hard as a rock.  I couldn't eat that at all. 
The atmosphere was pleasant to dine in and the service was exceptional.
Had the best t-bone here! tasty and tender...honey loved the chicken fried steak... I go here now instead of the buffet... much much better quality.

We were at the Silverton for the Easter Sunday Dinner Buffet which their website said started at 3pm. Went over to the counter at 3pm to find out that the Breakfast buffet ended at 3pm but dinner didn't start until 4pm. Which was totally contrary to what the website said. Huge pain in the ass. As we were already hungry and didn't want to wait  we headed to the Sundance Grill instead. 

Service was friendly. Food was worth what we paid for it. My wife got the New York Steak which was well prepared. I got the Pork Chops which were very good especially with the apple chutney that was served with it. Little guy got the breakfast for dinner which came with a giant (I do mean giant) bear head shaped pancake. Only gripe was that our son's kid's juice wasn't included with his meal and cost just as much as our adult drinks.

I live close to the Silverton Casino so I eat at the Sundance Grill often. It's nothing fancy, more of a diner style restaurant. The food is always good breakfast, lunch or dinner and reasonably priced. The service is always quick and the servers are very friendly. Open 24 hours so it makes a quiet late night spot off strip too!

Very reasonable food that is also reasonably priced,  good service,  good atmosphere and located right inside the Silverton casino. this place is open24h and is kid friendly. i thought the gelati ice cream was way too sweet but the kids loved it.

I have never had such a rude and inattentive waitress as I did here on Friday April 7th. As I was giving my order to Stephanie she interrupted me and said she knew exactly what I wanted. My order was simple the unfortunate part is I wanted to add something to it and never had the opportunity. We had to flag down other severs to help refill out beverages. Overall our meal was just ok..hence the 2star rating.  I would recommend that Stephanie have a customer service e training with her manager on how to properly take her patrons order and stop by to check in and see how our meal is and refill the simple water & soda beverages.

Surf n Turf for me @ Silverton Hotel & Casino and an Asian Chicken Salad for my companion.  

Inexpensive, nice setting, not the greatest, but no bad either.  Good place to grab a bite if you're on your way out of Las Vegas and don't want to head to far off the I-15 nor head back to the main strip.

Have been there for their breakfast which is pretty good except that their Bellinis aren't quite what I am used to.  But can't beat the price.

I'm going to give them a 3.75 rating because it is just a cafe style place, with tons and tons of seating. I ordered the giant ham steak and it was definitely giant sized, but wasn't out of this world good. Eggs were cooked perfectly over medium, hash browns and toast finished off this breakfast platter for $12. 

Service was excellent, as I sat at the counter so I could watch the 5 TV's showing Sunday football. No issues here, quick and efficient with frequent offers to warm up my coffee. 

Prices might be a bit higher than normal places, but it is a casino after all. I have zero complaints, and that's a good thing.

This place has a little of everything.
Breakfast, Burgers, Wraps, Steaks and Salads for healthier choices.

During my hotel stay at Silverton, I ate here 3 times. I could not pass up the deal at the time. It was buy one entree, get one free. How could anyone resist? 

The food and service were average. The first meal I had was a pepperoni pizza. It was nothing special. One cool thing was it was a huge serving. The second meal I had was this weird  burger wrap. The thing that sold me on it was it came with a chipotle sauce, but when I tasted the wrap, you could barely taste it. All you could taste is the bland ground beef. The third meal I had was a Caesar Salad Wrap and that was surprisingly good. The dressing was perfect.

I would only recommend this place if there is a deal going on or if you are staying at this hotel. It is super convenient and is opened 24-7.

Above average ambiance.  Maybe slightly better than average food. I didn't feel the prices were in line for an off strip joint.  

Service we got there was slow.  Took about 2 hours to get in and out from putting our names down to getting sandwiches and omelets during a weekday. It was pretty much the only full restaurant open in the place for lunch when they have like 5 of them.  

Cutting service so much won't get more people into your casino.

I DO NOT recommend Sundance Grill at Silverton Casino. The service is awful. Me and 3 other friends shared an order of nachos and a special breakfast meal. It took 45 minutes to get our food AND the restaurant wasn't busy at all.

Open 24 hours and a real beautiful place. Party of 12 (includes 8 kids) eating @ 10:30 at night after a movie. Real good food for reasonable prices and okay service (our waitress was not on point and not ready for us). Anyhow we enjoyed ourselves especially our food and we will be coming back.

just came from silverton the prime rib looked great. my problem was with the buffalo wings. can you really justify paying  $11.00 for 6 wings ??? 3 drums and 3 flats I could  have gone  to any other place and had gotten double the amount . Was this a mistake ?? If this was not a mistake I will never pay your prices again.

Ive been to Sundance Grill many times. I've had many many things off there menu- there are some highs- and a decent amount of lows.

firstly, there high- there salad is good, not enough options- would be nice if you were able to add chicken,steak, or shrimp to a salad for a fee.

there sandwiches are bleck at best breads usually hard, and the french fries are by far the worse ive ever had. i know french fries arent supposed to be amazing but i mean, c'mon.... mcdonalds fries shouldnt be better than yours.....

graveyard, the pizzas usually come out raw- and i mean raw.......

the upsides..... there strawberry dessert is good (strawberry shortcake) 
there steak is alright.....

there chicken bowl is alright...... sauce is too sweet and the crunchy noodles are nasty. 

not enough selection of gelato flavors

also a few times ive had issues such as raw pizzas (4-5x) hard rice (burnt) rotted baked potatoes..... 

it would really be nice if they improved there sandwiches, changed there fries, and added more salad options (and made an add salad option to the sandwiches)

but pleaseeeeee!!!! change the fries (o and the chips as the replacement are gross!!!

Much nicer than you may expect, and much bigger too! It's a cozy atmosphere in the dining room, and the bar has seating too. The few times I've eaten here recently have been mixed experiences.  It's been busy when we've eaten here, and we sat at the bar during our latest visit. The salmon entree I had was yummy, especially after I finally got sauce with it! The sides are good sized, and the salad was very good. Rolls are served with entrees, and they were nice and fresh. 

I've had the reuben here too, which was pretty good. The wait to get it was way too long, however. The kitchen seemed overwhelmed, and it showed. The menu pretty much covers it all, from salads to steak, pasta and seafood entrees. 

The gelato "bar" at the restaurant's entrance is nice and isn't crazy expensive. The decor is in keeping with the Silverton's outdoorsy theme, and could even be called a bit classy. It's a step above the typical cafe style, and one reason why I recommend giving it a try.

CRISPY ALMOND FRENCH TOAST
 - delicious
 - crunchy
 - buttery
 - fattening
 - delicious (but depends on the cook really, I've had it a few times and the last visit was kind of bleh)

Service is slow and wait staff isn't the best but the food's decent, the slots pay out and it's in Silverton which is fast becoming a great hotel to stay at when you're in Vegas.

Seems like every time we come here the service gets worse and worse. When they first opened the food was great, service was awesome and prices were lower. Now I simply cannot give one star in any category. 

The service was so terrible! Lisa was her name. She cared more about clearing 3 tables before taking our order. I felt that was her being greedy! She wanted more customers than to help the ones she already had. After 20 minutes she finally came to take our order. After 15 more minutes the food came out. Mine was cold, in fact the plate was warmer than my food. The butter wouldn't melt over my French Toast. My husbands toast was barely toasted, his hash browns were cold, my daughters bagel was half toasted, my sons French Toast wasn't cooked. 

When Lisa came back for my cold food she ripped the plate from the table, she was rude, showed zero care, didn't apologize, a manager never came to the table and I still payed for a half cooked meal. 

But I can tell you that the bus boy, aka the soda man, was AMAZING!! He was quick with service, polite, sincere and apologetic regarding the server... Lisa! 

Our family and I have agreed that we will NOT be visiting the cafe anymore. A few bad experiences was enough! In fact same on us for giving you guys another chance. Bye-Bye Sundance Cafe!

Dinner time  Another failed mis managed venue 
Long waiting lines  they are out of pagers and all you can see lots of empty tables with  lots of waiters !!!
Unless you come here at midnight when the place looks deserted--- go elsewhere for dinner!
Hope the Restaurant manage or food and beverage manager  of this nice hotel  are reading this comment.
Came here for the breakfast, had Joe's shuffle. It was lacking flavor but it was fulfilling. The orange juice was good though.

A very average casino cafe. The service is pretty good, although when we arrived there was a 15 minute wait and the restaurant was practically empty. I assume they understaff this restaurant when they don't expect a large crowd, but other than that, I had no issues. 

I ordered an omelet and it was very regular. Tasty, but nothing spectacular. Our server was incredibly friendly and our glasses were always refilled. Definitely don't go out of your to come here, but it's a good alternative if you're in the area and don't want to spend too much on a quick bite.

So me and my family came here for a Christmas dinner. The place wasn't packed and it was around dinner time. Everyone seemed to want to hit up the buffet which is expected in Vegas.  There was a prefixed Christmas dinner which wasn't bad. It came with a choice of salad/soup, prime rib n shrimp, and choice of strawberry shortcake/pecan pie.   Our server took awhile to get to us but we didn't mind it since their menu was huge.  I had their prefixed menu and the prime rib was good and big.  The meat was juicy and shrimp was good but it had this green sauce on it that kind of threw us off but wasn't bad.  The strawberry shortcake was delicious and served with ice cream.  The server who served us was sick and had mentioned it but I found it a little disturbing as he is serving food. Not to mention I am pregnant. We had to wait awhile for our refills which he forgot half of the table.  He was nice though.  I would definitely come back for the shortcake.
